image.altText: Flinders Ranges in South Australia

props.synopsis: Native title holders in South Australia's Flinders Ranges win the right to access financial records showing how tens of millions of dollars in mining royalties have been spent, after the state's Supreme Court upheld an earlier ruling.

title.children: Native title holders win right to see records of mining millions

image.altText: A man surrounded by reporters holding microphones and mobile phones outside court

props.synopsis: A relative of former NDIS worker Brandon Chesney — who impersonated a nurse at the Royal Adelaide Hospital on 13 different occasions, and assaulted a patient — says she believes he should have been imprisoned and that he "isn't remorseful".

title.children: Man who impersonated nurse 13 times and assaulted patient avoids jail

image.altText: An Aboriginal woman with grey hair is wearing red cat-eye glasses, a white t shirt and quandong seed necklace looks off camera.

props.synopsis: After 40 years in storage, archival materials are helping share the story of the "groundbreaking" first Aboriginal Women's Art Festival. One elder says it broke down barriers for First Nations women and put their art in focus like never before.

title.children: Archival materials shining a light on 'groundbreaking' arts event

image.altText: A woman with sunglasses on outside court next to a camera operator

props.synopsis: A diabetic woman accused of murdering her elderly parents, by injecting them with her own insulin, suffered undue hardship while in jail for breaching her bail.

title.children: Woman accused of murdering parents spared breach of bail conviction

image.altText: A blonde man in his 40s wearing a blue suit and tie walking in front of a road in Adelaide

props.synopsis: The former SA opposition leader pleaded guilty to two counts of supplying or administering a drug that wasn't cannabis to another person.

title.children: Former SA opposition leader David Speirs pleads guilty to drug charges

image.altText: Ben McDermott plays a shot off his pads as the wicketkeeper and fielders watch on

props.synopsis: Queensland will need a big day three with the bat as it looks to set up a chance of winning a dramatic Sheffield Shield final against South Australia. Follow the scores and stats in our ScoreCentre.

title.children: Sheffield Shield final live: All eyes on Queensland batters on pivotal third day

image.altText: Aerial artist impression of a shiny skyscraper with a city skyline visible behind.

props.synopsis: Adelaide's Festival Plaza is being lost to commercial interests, critics of a proposed skyscraper say, amid calls for a rethink about how the Riverbank precinct is being developed.

title.children: Festival Plaza skyscraper shows 'lack of vision' for Adelaide's Riverbank

image.altText: Mathew Hawks stands behind his father just outside a doorway to the Peninsula Hotel

props.synopsis: The family of one-punch victim Luke Sweetman has expressed disappointment in the sentence of his killer, and called for more protections at pubs and hotels.

title.children: Adelaide man sentenced to six years in prison for fatal one-punch attack

image.altText: Jordon Sweet of the Power is challenged by Archie Roberts of the Bombers.

props.synopsis: Trailing at the final change, the Bombers finish over the top of the Power to claim a thrilling two-goal victory, their first of the season.

title.children: Bombers defeat Power by two goals for first AFL win of the season

image.altText: Two lead smelters side by side in a composite image

props.synopsis: The operator of smelters in South Australia and Tasmania is urging state and federal governments to provide "essential" financial support, after its facilities were described as "uncompetitive assets".

title.children: Owner of ‘uneconomical’ Port Pirie and Hobart smelters calls for government help to stay afloat

image.altText: A sinkhole surrounded by rock and greenery and a viewing platform.

props.synopsis: The Mount Gambier council is seeking expressions of interests from companies wanting to hire out electric scooters in the city, but there are concerns they could be thrown into the Cave Gardens.

title.children: E-scooter trial despite fears they will be thrown into sinkhole

image.altText: A large white boat with TACOMA on its hull

props.synopsis: After pioneering tuna fishing in Port Lincoln more than 70 years ago, the Tacoma has just delivered water to a parched sheep farm on an island off the Eyre Peninsula.

title.children: Historic tuna boat delivers much-needed water to thirsty island sheep

image.altText: A view of a bay of turquoise and darker blue water, and a white sand beach.

props.synopsis: New figures suggest last year's turmoil dealt a severe blow to New Caledonia's population, as French nationals left the territory in search of jobs or to escape violence.

title.children: 'Everything collapsed': Why thousands have left a Pacific paradise

image.altText: Natasha Stott Despoja at South Australia's Royal Commission into Domestic, Family and Sexual Violence.

props.synopsis: South Australians living with a disability have reportedly had their hands shackled with rope, their wheelchair tyres punctured and food withheld by family members and carers, the state's domestic violence royal commission has heard.

title.children: People living with disability subjected to 'terrible things', DV royal commission hears

image.altText: A giant flame roars from gas flare stack, silhouetted against the dusk sky

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton vows to "immediately" force gas giants to set aside for domestic use as much as 20 per cent of supply that would "otherwise be exported", cutting wholesale prices by 40 per cent.

title.children: Dutton promises lower energy prices with plan to tap gas exports

image.altText: Older man in a suit wearing a a suit and waving

props.synopsis: King Charles is forced to cancel public engagements after being taken to hospital due to side-effects from his ongoing cancer treatment, Buckingham Palace says.

title.children: Palace says king was hospitalised with cancer treatment side-effects

image.altText: A person walks across a concreted area in the foreground. Behind them is Greenland's capital Nuuk.

props.synopsis: The Russian president says he worries NATO countries could use the Arctic as a "springboard for future conflicts".

title.children: US plan to take over Greenland 'serious', Putin says

image.altText: Stuart Hume

props.synopsis: As another Aboriginal family says goodbye to their brother who died in custody, legal and health experts are frustrated that efforts to minimise hanging points in jail cells are 'painfully slow'.

title.children: Stuart's family say he asked for help but didn't get it. Days later he was dead

image.altText: A man speaking. In this picture, only his face is visible.

props.synopsis: Ukraine's leader accuses the US of "constantly changing" a minerals deal linked to military aid, as cracks in the already fractured relationship between Kyiv and Washington widened on Thursday.

title.children: Zelenskyy accuses US of 'constantly changing' minerals deal

image.altText: ASX in Sydney

props.synopsis: The ASX 200 regains ground, given a boost by gold stocks. Meanwhile, analysts expect the election to have a "limited" impact on markets. Follow live.

title.children: ASX regains ground, election tipped to have 'limited' impact on markets

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Cost of living a key election issue
Virgin-Qatar deal clears final hurdle, with flights expected from June
Rates likely to stay on hold as May 3 election called: RBC

image.altText: Peter Dutton smiles during QT.

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton has delivered his response to the government's budget and it's big on petrol and gas, with barely a word on nuclear.

title.children: Dutton's latest barrage in Coalition's 25-year war with itself on fuel excise

image.altText: Aerial view of cracked light brown clay with a bright green soy plant growing out of a crack in the middle.

props.synopsis: Soil moisture has declined more than 2,600 gigatonnes since 2000, making a greater contribution to sea level rise than Greenland's melting ice sheets.

title.children: Earth has lost more than '4,000 Sydney Harbours' of fresh water

props.synopsis: Very senior members of the Trump administration have this week been caught mistakenly sharing secret plans to bomb the Houthi rebel group in Yemen with a journalist. Today, David Smith, from the United States Studies Centre on the great ‘Signalgate’ scandal.

title.children: ABC News Daily: Team Trump’s ‘comically incompetent’ group chat

image.altText: A young man with a bear and afro wearing sunglasses looks at a phone camera.

props.synopsis: The brother of slain underworld figure Hamad 'the executioner' Assaad has won a court battle with his family over the sale of a home in Sydney's west.

title.children: Family of slain infamous underworld figure entangled in property dispute

image.altText: Patient in hospital bed has their hand held.

props.synopsis: Doctors often prescribe strong medications to relieve pain, distress and discomfort in palliative care, but many of these drugs have recently been unavailable or difficult to access.

title.children: 'A basic human right': Pain drug shortages cause problems in palliative care

image.altText: A white man with sandy-coloured curly hair wearing a black t-shirt holds a smartphone in his palm

props.synopsis: Tech giant Meta used millions of pirated books by Australian authors including Hannah Kent, Charlotte Wood and Tim Winton to train its AI language model.

title.children: High-profile Australian authors furious at Meta's AI 'plundering' their work

image.altText: Organised crime figure Alvin Chau

props.synopsis: The Queensland government has released a report that upholds the ABC's revelation that a Brisbane casino owner had a "concealed relationship" with a jailed junket boss.

title.children: Government report backed ABC revelation of casino owner's hidden ties

image.altText: The outside of the Nine Entertainment headquarters in North Sydney.

props.synopsis: The data of 16,000 readers of the Sydney Morning Herald, The Age and The Financial Review is exposed online following a major cyber security breach

title.children: Nine newspapers subscribers have data exposed online in breach

image.altText: A graphic showing Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton with bowser pumps, in front of a background of hundred dollar bills.

props.synopsis: A policy fight over cost-of-living relief has emerged with a federal election looming. Labor and the Coalition have both promised to ease hip pocket pain, but voters will be asked to choose between income tax cuts or cheaper petrol.

title.children: Compare the pair: Which major party's tax policy leaves you better off?

image.altText: A British journalist standing in a crowd of protesters waving Turkish flags at night.

props.synopsis: Almost 1,900 people have now been detained amid the largest anti-government protests in the country in more than a decade.

title.children: BBC journalist deported from Turkiye after covering protests

image.altText: A taxidermied penguin on a tray at the CSIRO in Canberra.

props.synopsis: The collections include 99 per cent of Australia's native birds as well as exotic bird species, skeletons, mammals, reptiles stored in ethanol, eggs and frozen tissue.

title.children: 'Small piece in a really big jigsaw': Penguin frozen in time finds home

image.altText: A boat on the ocean

props.synopsis: The submarine was carrying 45 tourists and crew while sailing in the Red Sea near Hurghada.

title.children: Tourist submarine sinks in Egypt, killing six and injuring nine

image.altText: RFK Jr Senate confirmation hearing

props.synopsis: The health secretary says the move will reduce "bureaucratic sprawl" but has led to concerns it would lead agencies to drastically scale back their operations.

title.children: Robert F Kennedy Jr to cut 10,000 US health department jobs

image.altText: A whole, halved and sliced Shepard avocado, one variety commonly available in Australia.

props.synopsis: Hass avocados are out of season for the next few months, meaning those craving an avo fix may have to turn to the often-maligned Shepard variety. But despite the bad rap, Shepard avocados have their own strengths.

title.children: Shepard avocados get a 'bad rap'. Here’s how to enjoy them
